intro: Psychotria horizontalis subsp. glaucina, commonly known as the glaucous psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its lanceolate, glaucous (bluish-gray) leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in rainforests. The species is notable for its chemical composition, which includes various alkaloids, though it is not as well-studied as other Psychotria species.
